subtasks.hazard: Blank Missuse or Weapon Malfunction Causing Bodily Harm

values: required PPE while on the range beginning at the staging area with the RSO confirming all appropriate PPE is worn including ACH, face mask, goggles, IOTV, ear pro, gloves. Soldiers will also be instructed to aim for center mass, away from the head area.
Lane safeties and the OIC / RSO will ensure weapon systems are properly oriented downrange and operating in a safe manner at all times.
be loaded prior to the beginning of each lane.
From the staging area/ammo point all weapon systems will be locked to the rear and cleared and all magazines will be loaded once at the start line and the OIC/RSO have instructed.
Weapons will be visual cleared by RSO following completion of the lane.
PPE will not be removed until all weapon systems have been cleared and personnel moved back to the staging area. RSO will give all clear.
Ensure a Medic and a dedicated vehicle is available at all times.
All firers will be qualified on their assigned weapon systems prior to execution.
Leaders will identify targets and mark left and right limits of sectors of fire.

values: vehicle PMCS prior to movement, all Soldier's will adhere to posted speed limit signs, drive
Ground guides will be used when maneuvering all vehicles onto the range or motorpool.
Use of proper hand and arm signals when maneuvering all vehicles.
Conduct safety brief at each phase, addressing: speed, route, and vehicle safety

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO, FROM, AND ON TRAINING SITE

values: Brief crews on procedures below during limited visibility conditions.

PCCs and PCIs Brief limited visibility conditions during safety brief.

subtasks.hazard: Combustions / Fire at the ammo point

values: least two 10 pound fire extinguishers on hand.
No smoking withing 50m of ammo point
Ammo will be stored in accordance with QUASAS Range OPS, and 2CR policy.
Ammo point inspected by RSO and OIC
Use of snow chains when snow and ice are on the ground.
Reduce vehicle speed based on road condition
Use of ground guides and chem lights during poor visibility due to weather.
If lightning is in the immediate area all personnel will move to the nearest grounded hard stand structure or spread out in low ground away from all equipment.
Ensure Soldiers know how to install snow chains properly. Brief inclement weather condition and safety measures during safety brief
Brief all Soldiers on procedure when finding a UXO.
Clear the area surrounding the UXO.
Mark UXO, call EOD and Range Operations.
OIC will monitor temperature and humidity of ground surface.
Verify fire danger posted by Range Operation daily.
Identify fire team and have appropriate FFE on-hand and ready.
OIC will place range in "DRY" status and notify Range Operation.
Range OIC/RSO will monitor the weather and change the uniform accordingly.
Prior to execution, troops will receive a brief on the approved SDZs.
Range orientation brief during daily range safety brief by RSO.
Weapon systems properly cleared before leaving the firing line.
Range orientation brief from the OIC/RSO prior to training

subtasks.hazard: Trauma wounds from sim-round shot, ricochet, or loss of consciousness due to tripping or cold injury

values: Leaders will monitor the health and condition of their Soliders and initiate medical care in the event of noticing injuries or symptoms.
Safeties are alert and mindful of Soldiers condition.
Inspect all weapons, magazines, and equipment prior to training, to ensure no live ammunition is present. All soldiers will be given sim-round bolts, and checked for proper installation.
Perform inspections of MWE to ensure they are equipped with proper ammunition and equipment.

subtasks.hazard: Soldiers unfamiliar with the training operation and safety measures.

values: All Soldiers will receive a safety brief and site familiarization prior to training with UTM
The OIC will brief all Soldiers on the safety requirements.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The OIC, RSO, and range leadership will conduct a range safety brief prior to all training. The OIC and RSO are overall responsible for safety. However, safeties and instructors have the responsibility to be actively engaged in range activities and Soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event. Safety Brief and inspections will also ensure all other mentioned risks are properly mitigated. At least one vehicle and medic will be on site in the unlikely event of any serious injuries.
